root.title: Mainz 167 (T I D x 20)
root.history: The beginning of the Middle Ages.
root.place: Found during the archeological excavations of the First German Turfan expedition (Erste Preußische Turfanexpedition 409) in East Turkestan.
root.store: It is stored in the Berlin-Brandenburg Academy of Sciences (Berlin-Brandenburgischen Akademie der Wissenschaften).
root.general: The glazed fragment. This fragment is a part of one manuscript with 173a, b (Wilkens, №575) and U 174a,b (Wilkens, №587). It is considered that the fragment is its average part.
root.description: Manuscript: Old Turkic. Paper: soft, thick, light yellow. Quantity of lines: 4 lines in each in A, B; written in black. Designations: A, between 2nd and 3rd lines: Т I D x 20 (pencil). The stickers Mainz 167 (across) and T I D x 20 (vertical) are pasted on the left top part of the external side of glass. Characteristics: colon marks are outlined in red.
root.size: Distance between lines: 0.9 cm. 3.5 cm (height) x 4.7 cm (width).
root.investigation: L.Clark 422 claims that the fragment is a part of the manuscript of the story "Mentions Demon". Also Sertkaya 424 conducted researches.
root.details: Depositum der BERLIN-BRANDENBURGISCHEN AKADEMIE DER WISSENSCHAFTEN in der STAATSBIBLIOTHEK ZU BERLIN - Preussischer Kulturbesitz. Orientabteilung.Mainz 167 (T I D x 20).
